Posts.Content: Jul 21, 2018 04:38PM LovelyLeo wrote: Hi Anna, I think that's what I'm afraid of. It had already spread to so many of my lymph nodes before surgery which gives me enough anxiety. Now I'm worried the same will happen in between chemo treatments.
Posts.Title: Stopping Chemo for 2 months to deliver? Worried LovelyLeo Anna-33

Posts.Content: LovelyLeo wrote: Has this happened with anyone else? I start chemo next Wednesday. AC for 4 rounds dose dense. Then I'll stop until after I deliver. I'm due December 5 but they'll most likely induce at week 35/36 which would be the end of October or the beginning of November. A couple weeks later I'll start Taxol (I believe that's the name) for 12 weeks. I'm worried about stopping chemo in September and not starting back up until possibly November. Log in to post a reply
